Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Oriental_Guest
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 9 nights, during holidays in Dubai. It was peak time and we could not find anohter hotel with reasonable price. The place was very dirty - kitchen and bathroom in particular. Very poor cleaning service. The sofas were so dirty that we had to request for additional bedcover to put on the sofas so that we can use that. The TV was not working well, and after some requests, they fixed it. Certainly not recommended to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best to stay away”
Reviews.Author: tmatt15
Reviews.Content: * online photographs do not reflect the standard of the hotel and seem to depict former glory * given the state of the hotel, the room rates are too high and other, better hotels are available in the Mankhool area * the hotel gives a run-down and unclean impression (but no prostitutes) * the staff were not at all helpful and untrained Hotel standard Based on the pictures and reviews provided on booking.com my partner and I opted for this hotel over two other hotel apartments we had previously stayed in (and were satisfied with). In fact, the room at Richmond hotel apartments was slightly more expensive than said hotels and based on the assumption of a relation between price and hotel standard, we decided to give Richmond Hotel Apartments a shot. Now, while the foyer in the photograph provided on several websites is indeed that of Richmond Hotel Apartments, it must be several years old! These days it looks run down, messy and the couch has been replaced by two 1 Dirham massage chairs! The pictures of the outside of the hotel are equally misleading -the place is surrounded by large sandy areas that are used as parking lots. The hotel is also located on a busy road and the traffic and occasional shouting from outside made for a bad night's sleep. AC in the hallways did not work. No bed covers. Cleanliness On the way to our room, we were greeted by a "liquid" stained-mattress that was standing in the hall way, and was not removed until several hours later. Entering our allocated room, the first thing we noticed was an unpleasant smell - a mixture of mould and cold smoke! The furniture and equipment of this place are of older date, which in itself is not a problem. However, stains and holes in the bed linens, mould in the shower and kitchen, as well as hairs of the previous guest in the bed and on the floor are! Generally, flat surfaces of any kind were sticky, patches of wallpaper were missing in several places and the safety deposit box did not work. Thick layers of dust and grease in the kitchen and living room. Only 1 semi-clean towel in double-bed room. Staff The receptionists wanted to hang on to our passports for several hours only agreed to make copies etc . immediately after several firm requests. Had to follow up on taxi request, as the receptionist had forgotten first request, since he was busy chatting with one of his mates/colleagues! Generally staff did not seem to care, but this relates probably to the wider problem with working conditions and dubious working contracts for foreign workers in the UAE. Internet The wireless connection is very slow and during our stay went on and off in 1 or 2 min intervals. We therefore used the computers provided in the “business centre" (2 PCs with dirty keyboards – bring disinfectant along!). Gym Very small space with four or five machines (stationary bike etc) and some small weights. Small and dark place - AC did not seem to work and temperatures must have been 20C+ on that floor. Bottom line Receptionist said that they consider themselves a 3 Star hotel. This is, in light of our experiences, a complete joke. It is mainly the un-cleanliness of the place, as well as the misleading information about the hotel's standard that are not acceptable. Under better management, this place could actually be quite decent. We tried to find alternative lodging for the night, but all other hotels in the area were booked out - so we had to stay the night at Richmond Hotel. In its current state, this is a 1 star hotel at best - we have been to the UAE several times and have a pretty good idea of what's out there in terms of hotels and hotel apartments. If they would offer 50dhs rooms, at least you'd know what you're getting into - but this place gives false impressions and seems to base its rates on that information. The hotel’s location is OK and Al Karama Metro station is only a 20min walk away. However, as a result of the sum of the mentioned problems this is without doubt the worst place I have stayed in and would therefore not recommend Richmond Hotel Dubai to anyone. Attached are also some pictures from the outside and inside.

Reviews.Title: “It's not right, but it's okay”
Reviews.Author: Sarahprh
Reviews.Content: I booked this because it was cheap, cheap, cheap. Got there and first impressions were okay. No hairdryer, but had luckily packed my own. No safe. No toaster, but they brought me one up as soon as I asked for it. No kettle, but I'd brought my own. Big balcony, but no furniture on the balcony. Patio door tricky to lock. As for cleanliness.....................hmmm. The "maid" at the hotel is a 16 year old boy, and it shows. Dust swept into corners and left there. Rusty nail stayed on the floor by the door for the whole of my 6 night stay. Long blonde hairs on the pillows when I arrived. Toilet leaks on the floor, but luckily it appeared to be clean water. Slightly grubby, but I tried to keep cheerful, as it was so cheap. This place is miles from anywhere. You need a taxi to get to the metro station, then a taxi when you get off the metro to wherever you are going. I walked everywhere the first day, and I was exhausted! Luckily, each taxi journey is only about £2. Getting from the airport in a normal taxi cost less than £10. Bargain. The hotel's own car is a bit expensive - I paid 30 AED (about £8) to go to the souks, and a normal taxi would probably have been cheaper. I took some tinned food in my suitcase, jam, coffee, flora spread and some bread. I was able to make some breakfast and dinner in the room, as there is a microwave and toaster, and it saved me a bit of money. Local bread is wierdly sweet. Some local men are a bit rude - they don't hold open doors for you, or say thank you if you do it for them. Also, the traders at the souk can get on your nerves a bit by trying to get you in their shops, calling out to you, being a bit sleazy. A firm "No Thank You" does the trick. All in all, so long as you are aware that you'll need to go everywhere in the (fairly cheap) taxis, and are prepared for below-standard cleanliness, this place will do you fine. It was cheap enough to remain fairly cheerful about it all.

Reviews.Title: “Spend more and go somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: xazzo
Reviews.Content: Yes, it IS very cheap for Dubai...but you get what you pay for. Hotel situated close to a road with traffic noise, also during the nights - slept OK for 1 night out of 4! Rooms OK but OLD furniture, and the equpment for the kitchen is a joke! Same with the socalled "fitness center"...When we tried to heat water with the old tea boiler from the kitchen, this almost broke the device! 1 knife,2 forks, 2 cups etc...no micro wave, no hair dryer. Almost no hot water - after we used some hot water the second day,there was no more hot water for the rest of the stay! Ok pool area, although only 2 sunbeds! Cleaning ok, and reception staff friendly and allowed early check in. Location not very good, few shops and restaurants nearby, but ok, a cab to the beach or to the creek costs 2EUR... Spend a little more and go somewhere else - this is not 3 star, it is (max) 2 star!

Reviews.Title: “Clean”
Reviews.Author: Archiismummy
Reviews.Content: Just back from Richmond Hotel we found very helpful staff, it was very clean and suitable for our needs. It was a good way from main town but taxi cab fares cheap. only complaint we booked early morning wake up call and it never came would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: WorthyJust
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay. The Staff were friendly and very helpful. Although house-keeping was of very poor quality. The toilet, bathtub, refrigerator and balcony were never cleaned during our stay even though the housekeeper came in daily to make the bed and vacuum clean. Hotel Management should address this

Reviews.Title: “A GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: anandr_81
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel. This hotel is located very much within the city and hence we found it confortable commuting. The hotel is well maintained and was clean & tidy. Room was not big but not small either, confortable for a couple. The room had a small kitchen area with a Fridge, Microwave, toaster & utensils. The hotel receptionist was courteous however the room service staff did not respond to our requests on time. The hotel needs to improve on the food quality. Food was very oily and did not taste good. We had food only once in the hotel and then opted to eat out. Most of the hotels in Dubai provide breakfast as complementary, however here the same was charged. The hotel needs to improve a lot on its food menu and quality. Overall a good hotel to say [not for food :-) ]

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: stopcomplainng
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 2009, nice hotel, my room/apartment was massive!!Staff weren't over friendly but fine, Breakfast isnt great so dont bother, theres a pool on the roof which is great!! Nice place though! Its not really in the cente of dubai though.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money, good service”
Reviews.Author: mjfrans
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this website i was afraid that i was not going to enjoy my time at the richmond hotel. I was however pleasantly surprised and i have to say that i cannot agree with the comments posted earlier. The hotel itself is located in a nice area with some good indian restaurants. In a few weeks time a metro station, al karama, will open, its about 10 minutes walk from the hotel and will make access to all the tourist sites even easier. The rooms in the hotel were good, had a nice bathroom and a small cooking area. The hotel swimming pool was also quite good, and there was a nice view of the dubai skyline. The best thing about this hotel was the service. We had booked the room for one night and had to check out at 12 in the afternoon. After having spent the entire day in dubai, we went back to the hotel to pick up our stuff. Seeing that dubai is a warm place we were sweaty and wanted to take a shower before catching our plane. The staff were very helpfull in accomodating us and didnt ask for extra money.This extra bit of service was wonderfull. If you are on a tight budget in dubai then dont hesitate, just book this hotel. It is extremely good value for money and the staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a bit more and go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Becz-Awa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is okay and what you'd expect from a 2 star hotel I guess. There is no excuse for poor customer service though and that's what we found when talking to the staff at reception - the concierge was nice though. Beware: they will ask you for your passport & they will hold onto it (apparently they require it to copy & send to the local police in case you get up to no good while staying in Dubai). My partner and I did not like the idea of leaving our passports with these people but did so and told the guy we wouldn't leave them with him for very long - we picked them up off him within half an hour but he didn't seem happy). We were taken to our room but as we walked down the dim corridor there were wires hanging from the roof!! Our room was okay and we slept well but the bathroom was small, the room had a view of other buildings and a noisy road and the room service food really wasn't that great. When you book a room in this hotel it claims it has a kitchen in the room which we thought would be handy instead of eating out all the time. We discovered that the 'kitchen' is only a bench and fridge with a couple of plates and ONE cup! You can't cook or heat anything up & you have to request extra cups. The swimming pool is on the roof & is very shallow so not that great and the gym is laughable - I wouldn't call it a gym, just a couple of old machines & a treadmill on it's last legs! The area isn't too bad, there is a supermarket just up the road which is handy & the Al Karama markets are within walking distance (about 20min walk) or a short taxi ride (taxi's are very cheap). One good thing about it is that it has free internet at the computers near reception. If you are on a budget then this is the place for you as it's comfortable but I would recommend spending a bit more & staying somewhere else if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience at hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: weninaz2010
Reviews.Content: I would only recommend the Richmond hotel apartments for anyone who absolutely cannot afford to stay anywhere else. The hotel is poorly maintained, noisy, not very clean, not located near shops or other businesses and staff is uncooperative when there are problems. The rooms have kitchenettes with fridge and microwave if you ask for it. It would be good for a solo traveler who is willing to stay in rough accomodations just to save money. For an additional 30 euros or 45 dollars more per night you can stay someplace that has many more features.

Reviews.Title: “If you dont have high standards this hotel is just right for you!”
Reviews.Author: martinf124
Reviews.Content: I went on holiday to Dubai in the begin of may 2009, with my partner, son and 10 other family members and friends. I was really looking forward to it as I had heard so much about the place and it was the first time we were taking my 4 year old son on holiday. we arrived at Dubai airport and are pick up which was arranged through the hotel was late, we had to phone the hotel to find out what was happening, they told us that it will be there in 15 minutes, we ended up waiting an hour in total from the time we come through customs. when he finally turned he realised there was not enough room in the minibus as there was 12 people which also meant 12 suitcases and 10 hand luggages, so he had to call for another mini bus, which there should of know already cause of the number of us in the group. We then finally arrived at the hotel and was given our room keys and had to give them are passports which we had to live with them for them to scan them, which I found quite odd. Finally got to our rooms at first glance the room looks OK. the room had a smell like damp, holes in the chairs, the room was not suitable for 2 adults and a child, there was just a king size bed in the room, we requested a bed for my son, the bedroom was small so they could not fit another bed in it which means they would be putting it in the front room, when they did come up with the bed, it turned out to be a cot. my son is 4 years old and not a baby how can you expect me to put him to sleep in a cot. with in also this time we had been up down to reception to complain about 5 times. They finally told us some other rooms well be free in the morning about 12 noon and we will be able to look at them and change room. while this was going on other people in are group were having the same or worst problems, bathroom dirty, fridge rusty, smelly rooms, no hot water, and also after moving rooms three times they still wasn't happy. i was going to wait till the morning to see what else was on offer. But same members of are group was so unhappy about the room they had that they were not prepared to sleep the night there, so they rang up the booking company in England and made a complaint. with in a hour they were taken to view a different hotel 2 minutes away called the Jormand Hotel which was cleaner and nicer then the Richmond hotel. so the next morning we were all transferred to the Jormand hotel [----] My advise if you going to Dubai for holiday to relax go to Jumeirah beach hotel it might be more expensive but in the long run it would be better cause you don't have to pay a lot on taxi fares every day to go to the beach. If you going to Dubai to shop for gold, knock of goods, etc and you like fast food and you just need a base to sleep at night and leave you stuff this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Quality”
Reviews.Author: ajay18
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable and convenient hotel apartments in the City. Located centrally in the Mankhool area it provides easy access to the Bur Dubai area and the Sheikh Zayed area.Recommended because is a very quiet and clean area.Staying here with kids is not a problem because of the strict admission policy that the hotel has i.e no hanky panky stuff going on. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Richmond Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenya61
Reviews.Content: Not a bad deal for a 3 star hotel. Staff was very good including room service but the hotel private cab was a rip off at times. Pool size was very small.The gym didn't have a lot of choice. A good clean hotel with everything working fine in the bedroom, bathroom, kitchen and the main hall. I would definetely like to come back to this hotel again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not recommended”
Reviews.Author: spudWalsallUk
Reviews.Content: Please read reviews before even contemplating staying here, it does not do what it says on the packet. this hotel is run by suits, (sometimes 5 a time behind reception) all trying to do their bit to ruin your holiday by penny pinching. the breakfast is a joke either eggs or croisants "no deviation" ,The resturant staff are surly and unhelpful the modern kichenette is a hotplate, microwave, 2 cups 2 knives, 2 plates etc; if your lucky! only tepid water in bathroom, you need to get up early if you want a sunbed, 4 when i left this morning. the shuttle to airport is not "free" get a taxi its cheaper. Only redeeming feature are houseboys who for a small tip (voluntary) will do there utmost to help you.Tips: dubai is a great place try to get somewhere near beach to use as a base, Please visit jumeirah beach park, a great place for kids. only use official taxis, unlicensed taxisare a con, enjoy this beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “you would have to have SERIOUSLY low expectations to be happy here”
Reviews.Author: christopherhaynes
Reviews.Content: *arranged for a hotel pick up which was supposed to be free [wasn't] provided my flight number and terminal details for collection. waited over an hour for the collection, called the hotel 4 times and eventually given the number of the driver. the hotel refused to call him on my behalf. the driver who spoke no english and i couldnt understand him at all. eventually he arrived and told me that he was waiting at terminal 1 [there were NO emirates flights to terminal 1 at this stage] there was another passenger who was arriving on a flight an hour later than mine who i was sharing with. dont bother with the pick up, a cab is £5 - £10 and a whole lot faster and plentiful. *checked in to a very dirty room, grease all over the kitchen, dirty bathroom, no coathangers, no cutlery, 1 plate, no glasses, 1 cup [all filthy and covered in grease] *moved to an 'executive suite' the next day which was somewhat better and cleaner. still no coat hangers. 1 glass. 1 plate. 1 knife..... [still dirty] and filthy pan. *all tap water is warm. no hot. no cold. no pressure in shower. *the only cold water is in the pool. *pool area floor is beyond filthy. many cracked tiles around the pool and very easy to slip because of the layer of grime. if you have kids you should give it a miss. *pool is open...... sporadically. *gym. forget it. *two pool loungers. dirty and broken. 2 pool chairs [same] *restaurant. honestly don't bother [shudder] *wifi access. pretty much doesnt work. they charge £10 for a 24 hour pass. they re-issue used passes and try to claim its your fault. when you complain and ask for a new pass, they just take the old one and put it back at the bottom of the pile of 'new' ones. *they demanded half of my reservation fees 2 days into a 9 day stay on the proviso that they needed the money for 'cash flow' when i said i wanted to pay by credit card they said they wanted cash. at the end of my stay their card facilities were down. it took a long time to check out and it took them 3 attempts to give me an accurate invoice. *reception staff = elitist beyond belief and clearly take enjoyment in taking advantage of guests. very unhelpful. smug. unwelcoming. just dont

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Corrupt, Racist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SteveDowd
Reviews.Content: Booked online via AsiaRooms.com, obtaining a 2 night stay for US$ 122 per room per night inclusive taxes. Arrived to be told they had no record of my reservation. Pulled out the printed confirmation, but after 20 minutes the lady receptionist said they had not received it. She told me they have rooms available, at US$190 - exactly the same room type I booked. They would not listen to my protests and clearly enjoyed the "do not care" and snobby attitudue of putting someone through a stressful frustrating time. I was about to give in, when an indian gentleman arrived to check-in - and guess what - at the rate of US$122. I pointed this out and the lady told me the lower rates are only for Indian nationals, as Europeans can afford to pay more. I was now at boiling point and asked to see the manager, who was either conveniently not around, or who is not bothered anyway. I left and booked into an Apartment hotel just down the road. I just wished I'd read this site review before booking!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service :(”
Reviews.Author: anirbas
Reviews.Content: I was picked up by the minibus provided by the hotel and I checked in early. All was good at the early stages, however I was disappointed when I went to the room and found that there was grease stains on the tiles in the kitchen and dirt/grime around the tap. This put me off cooking there. I then proceeded to the bathroom room and the toilet bowl was not cleaned properly and there was faeces splashed all aound it. I asked for someone to clean this up. They did this quick quickly. When I went back down to reception I was asked for payment straight away and given no explanation why this was needed. The receptionist was quite rude. I gave my passport to be scanned when I arrived, it took 6 hours for them to return it to me. However, they asked for it again and was not given a reason for this. There were also a lot of cooking smells in our room as the ventilation was poor. The staff are quite arrogant and rude and as it was the Dubai Shopping Festival we could not find anywhere esle to stay. The male staff were rude especially to females but not as much to men.

Reviews.Title: “Dismal place - rude staff”
Reviews.Author: kaytp
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel after a long flight from Istanbul. We had booked for a Studio. The receptionist Michelle, told us that since no studios were available she would upgrade us to a One bed apt. We were naturally very happy & checked into the apartment. After crashing out for a couple of hours, as we had travelled through the night, we woke up, unpacked & had our showers. At this point (3 hours after we had checked in) Michelle, the receptionist, calls & says, that the studio is now available & to please check out & move to the new room! We were put off & told her that we had already unpacked & we were tired after our long flight & it was grossly unfair to ask us to do so in such a short period. She vociferously insisted that she had told us that she was only giving us the room for a few hours & we now had to move. If she had told us that, we would not have unpacked & made ourselves comfortable- she was blatantly lying to cover up some mistake from her side. She kept insisting howver & said that another person had already paid for the suite we were in & so we agreed to move to the studio. We moved to the studio & left for shopping etc. & only came back late night. That's when we discovered, the bathroom door did'nt shut, the shower had no force at all, water came out in a drip, flush did'nt work & the safe in the room did'nt work as well. We called reception, dear Michelle again & told her about the faults. Her first reaction was to tell us that the previous tenant of the room had not made any complaints! We asked her to come to the room & check for herself if she thought we were making it up. She immediately said she was not allowed to do so, but grudgingly said that she would send the maintenance people up. 3 calls & 2 hours later no sign of any. we went down & told her that no one had come & all she could say was 'I've told the maintenance people, if they dont come what can I do?' - her exact words. What were we supposed to do? We told her that we were going out & if the room was not done by the time we returned, we would be checking out - her reaction - 'upto you'. No apologies, no assuarances. We did try to get rooms elsewhere, but as it was the wekend & the DSF was on we had no luck anywhere & we were forced to stay there. The flush was the only thing fixed & the maintenance people told us that the shower was faulty & short of changing it nothing could be done. My conclusion is that the room they gave us was up fpr maintenance & therefore was not available when we checked in. Later due to some mix-up, we were forced to move & had to put up with this crappy room. No one from the management side apologised or told us that things would be put right. Rooms are dated, but of decent size. Bathroom tiles were mouldy, carpet had stains. Location is terrible as you never get taxis anywhere. Cant imagine what it would be like in summer. Stay away from this hotel - charmless, dated & rude rude staff.
